p: Existing treatments for the prevention and treatment of periodontal disease are expensive and have selective and time-limited efficiency. Mechanical or ultrasound-assisted debridement involving the use of surgical or nonsurgical techniques and the costs associated with surgical treatments have been estimated at $4â€“5000 per patient in the United States [ 13]. In this context, the identification of alternatives with preventive and/or therapeutic value for the management of periodontal disease is imperative.
